docs.snippet: MILAN, Italy, Dec. 7 -- Maria Callas returned to La Scala Opera tonight as the star of its opening night presentation. The New York-born soprano sang for the first time the role of Paolina in Donizetti's little-known opera "Poliuto."
docs.lead_paragraph: MILAN, Italy, Dec. 7 -- Maria Callas returned to La Scala Opera tonight as the star of its opening night presentation. The New York-born soprano sang for the first time the role of Paolina in Donizetti's little-known opera "Poliuto."

headline.main: CALLAS IN RETURN TO LA SCALA OPERA; Notables in Milan Audience as Soprano Ends Rift That Began in 1958

byline.original: By MILTON BRACKERSpecial to The New York Times

docs.snippet: YESTERDAY (DEC. 9, 1960) GENERAL ASSEMBLY Elected Turkey, Chile and the United Arab Republic to nonpermanent seats on Security Council and elected El Salvador, Ethiopia, France, Jordan and Uruguay to the 'Economic and Social Council.
docs.lead_paragraph: YESTERDAY (DEC. 9, 1960) GENERAL ASSEMBLY Elected Turkey, Chile and the United Arab Republic to nonpermanent seats on Security Council and elected El Salvador, Ethiopia, France, Jordan and Uruguay to the 'Economic and Social Council.

docs.snippet: UNITED NATIONS, N.Y., Dec. 9 -- The General Assembly elected Chile and the United Arab Republic today as nonpermanent members of the Security Council. It failed to make a choice between Liberia and Portugal for a third seat.
docs.lead_paragraph: UNITED NATIONS, N.Y., Dec. 9 -- The General Assembly elected Chile and the United Arab Republic today as nonpermanent members of the Security Council. It failed to make a choice between Liberia and Portugal for a third seat.
docs.abstract: Assembly elects Uruguay, El Salvador, France, Jordan and Ethiopia; deadlocked in race between Belgium and India

headline.main: CHILE AND U.A.R. NAMED TO COUNCIL; Vote in U.N. Assembly Gives Them 2-Year Terms -- No Decision on Third Seat CHILE AND U.A.R. NAMED TO COUNCIL

byline.original: Special to The New York Times

docs.snippet: WASHINGTON, Dec. 9 (UPI) -- The General Accounting Office today cut off funds for a State Department branch after the department had refused to give Congress information dealing with possible "malfeasance of Foreign aid personnel" in South America.
docs.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON, Dec. 9 (UPI) -- The General Accounting Office today cut off funds for a State Department branch after the department had refused to give Congress information dealing with possible "malfeasance of Foreign aid personnel" in South America.
docs.abstract: US Gen Acctg Office bars funds for State Dept Inspector Gen's Office because of its refusal to give Repr Hardy data dealing with possible 'malfeasance' by foreign aid personnel in S Amer

headline.main: Federal Agency's funds Cut Off For Refusal to Give Data on Aid

docs.snippet: Week Ended Dec. 9, 1960 British pound sterling and Canadian dollar turned soft in foreign exchange dealings during the past week. Business turn-over was brisk at times.
docs.lead_paragraph: Week Ended Dec. 9, 1960 British pound sterling and Canadian dollar turned soft in foreign exchange dealings during the past week. Business turn-over was brisk at times.

docs.snippet: A WRITER can hardly be said to have arrived until he has been parodied. The wounds received are in the price of fame. Few gifted parodists trouble to waste incisive ridicule on the obscure and the unknown.
